properties.description: The pipeline that orchestrates converting parquet files to delta format with change data feed enabled, does a full load of the data, simulates data changes to the source delta tables, run the SynapseLakehouseSync pipeline again after no data changes occurred to verify no new data is added into Synapse.

activities.name: Spark - Convert Parquet to Delta Tables
activities.description: Run an Azure Databricks notebook that will convert 6 tables in parquet format to delta 2.0 format with change data feed enabled and adding an _Id column.

typeProperties.notebookPath: /Synapse Lakehouse Sync Tutorial/Convert Parquet to Delta Tables - AdventureWorks

activities.name: Execute - Full Load - SynapseLakehouseSync
activities.description: Execute the SynapseLakehouseSync pipeline to sync the AdventureWorks delta tables to the Synapse dedicated pool. This will be a full load since the data will not exist in Synapse yet.

dependsOn.activity: Spark - Convert Parquet to Delta Tables

activities.name: Spark - Simulate Data Changes
activities.description: Run an Azure Databricks notebook that simulates data changes (deletes, updates, and inserts) to the AdventureWorks delta tables.

typeProperties.notebookPath: /Synapse Lakehouse Sync Tutorial/Simulate Data Changes - AdventureWorks

activities.name: Execute - Changes - SynapseLakehouseSync
activities.description: Execute the SynapseLakehouseSync pipeline to sync the AdventureWorks delta tables to the Synapse dedicated pool. This will be an incremental load capturing the data changes that occurred in the previous step.

activities.name: Check table row counts for both loads
activities.description: Query the Synapse logging table to get the row counts from the delta tables and the table in Synapse for each sync process.

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT *, ABS(TableRowCountADLS - TableRowCountSynapse) AS Diff
FROM logging.SynapseLakehouseSyncRecordCount
ORDER BY TableName, RowInsertDateTime

activities.name: Drop Synapse Tables If Exist
activities.description: Drop any tables that exists in the Synapse dedicated pool. This allows for the pipeline to be executed repeatedly with the same results.

source.sqlReaderQuery:
DECLARE @sql NVARCHAR(MAX)

SELECT @sql = STRING_AGG(CONVERT(NVARCHAR(MAX), CONCAT('IF OBJECT_ID(''', TABLE_SCHEMA, '.', TABLE_NAME, ''', ''U'') IS NOT NULL DROP TABLE ', TABLE_SCHEMA, '.', TABLE_NAME, ';')), ' ')
FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES

--PRINT (@sql)
EXEC (@sql);

SELECT 1 AS a

activities.name: Wait - 10 seconds
activities.description: Sleep for 10 seconds between Synapse Lakehouse Sync loads.

dependsOn.activity: Check table row counts for both loads

activities.name: Execute - Changes - SynapseLakehouseSync_copy1
activities.description: Execute the SynapseLakehouseSync pipeline to sync the AdventureWorks delta tables to the Synapse dedicated pool. This will not load any data since no data changes have occurred on the source delta tables.

activities.name: Check table row counts for both loads - No Data Changes
activities.description: Query the Synapse logging table to get the row counts from the delta tables and the table in Synapse for each sync process. This should match the original row counts from before since no data changes should have occurred this third run.

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT *, ABS(TableRowCountADLS - TableRowCountSynapse) AS Diff
FROM logging.SynapseLakehouseSyncRecordCount
ORDER BY TableName, RowInsertDateTime
